snippet: Health authorities were concerned that the dog might have been infected and could have spread the disease, but the science surrounding the issue is unresolved.
abstract: Dog named Excalibur who belonged to Ebola-infected nurse Maria Teresa Romero Ramos is destroyed by Spanish health officials, even as protesters and animal rights activists surround Madrid home of the nurse and her husband; online petition calling for dog’s life to be spared drew hundreds of thousands of signatures.

byline.original: By RAPHAEL MINDER and PAM BELLUCK
byline.contributor: Raphael Minder reported from Madrid, and Pam Belluck from New York. Sabrina Tavernise contributed reporting from Washington, and Denise Grady from Galveston, Tex.

lead_paragraph: Health authorities were concerned that the dog might have been infected and could have spread the disease, but the science surrounding the issue is unresolved.

headline.main: Spain, Amid Protests, Destroys Dog of Ebola-Infected Nurse
headline.print_headline: Spain, Amid Protests, Destroys Dog of Ebola-Infected Nurse
